title: WALL STREET JOURNAL-BEST SELLERS
text:
Bestselling Books Week Ended Oct. 4th. 
FICTION 
1. "The Murder House" by James Patterson and David Ellis (Little, Brown) 
2. "Library of Souls" by Ransom Riggs (Quirk Books) 
3. "The Girl in the Spider's Web" by David Lagercrantz (Knopf) 
4. "Come Rain or Come Shine" by Jan Karon (G.P. Putnam's Sons) 
5. "After You" by Jojo Moyes (Pamela Dorman Books) 
6. "Make Me" by Lee Child (Delacorte Press) 
7. "Go Set a Watchman" by Harper Lee (HarperCollins) 
8. "The Cinder Spires: The Aeronaut's Windlass" by Jim Butcher (Roc) 
9. "All the Light We Cannot See" by Anthony Doerr (Scribner) 
10. "The Girl on the Train" by Paula Hawkins (Riverhead) 
NONFICTION 
1. "Killing Reagan" by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard (Henry Holt and Co.) 
2. "The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up" by Marie Kondo (Ten Speed) 
3. "Big Magic" by Elizabeth Gilbert (Riverhead) 
4. "Live Love Lead" by Brian Houston (FaithWords) 
5. "Why Not Me?" by Mindy Kaling (Crown Archetype) 
6. "Is This Together" by Ann Romney (St. Martin's Press/Dunne) 
7. "The 20/20 Diet" by Phil McGraw (Bird Street Books) 
8. "Furiously Happy" by Jenny Lawson (Flatiron Books) 
9. "Between the World and Me" by Ta-Nehisi Coates (Spiegel & Grau) 
10. "Rising Strong" by Brene Brown (Spiegel & Grau) 
FICTION E-BOOKS 
1. "The Murder House" by James Patterson and David Ellis (Little, Brown) 
2. "The Martian" by Andy Weir (Broadway) 
3. "After You" by Jojo Moyes (Pamela Dorman Books) 
4. "Pretty Girls" by Karin Slaughter (William Morrow) 
5. "Make Me" by Lee Child (Delacorte Press) 
6. "The Cinder Spires: The Aeronaut's Windlass" by Jim Butcher (Roc) 
7. "The Girl in the Spider's Web" by David Lagercrantz (Knopf) 
8. "Shadow Play" by Iris Johansen (St. Martin's Press) 
9. "Down the Rabbit Hole" by J.D. Robb, Mary Blaney, Elaine Fox, Mary Kay McComas and R.C. Ryan (Jove) 
10. "About a Vampire" by Lynsay Sands (Avon) 
NONFICTION E-BOOKS 
1. "Killing Reagan" by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard (Henry Holt and Co.) 
2. "The 20/20 Diet" by Phil McGraw (Bird Street Books) 
3. "The Tudors" by G.J. Meyer (Random House) 
4. "I Can See Clearly Now" by Dr. Wayne W. Dyer (Hay House) 
5. "Why Not Me?" by Mindy Kaling (Crown Archetype) 
6. "The Sweet Life in Paris" by David Lebovitz (Crown-Archetype) 
7. "Change Your Thoughts" by Dr. Wayne W. Dyer (Hay House) 
8. "Unlimited Memory" by Kevin Horsley (Kevin Horsley) 
9. "The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up" by Marie Kondo (Ten Speed Press) 
10. "Furiously Happy" by Jenny Lawson (Flatiron Books) 
Nielsen BookScan gathers point-of-sale book data from about 16,000 locations across the U.S., representing about 85 per cent of the nation's book sales. Print-book data providers include all major booksellers and Web retailers, and food stores. E-book data providers include all major e-book retailers. Free e-books and those sold for less than 99 cents are excluded. The fiction and nonfiction lists in all formats include both adult and juvenile titles; the business list includes only adult titles. The combined lists track sales by title across all print and e-book formats; audio books are excluded. Refer questions to Michael.Boone(at)wsj.com.
